Package graph

Class Graph<V,E>

java.lang.Object
graph.Graph<V,E>
public class Graph<V,E> extends Object
Graph represents an immutable collection of Vertices (also called nodes) and edges. Each Edge connects two Vertices. The Edge in this graph is directed. For example, an edge e = [A,B] indicates that B is directly reachable from A or there is a one-way path from A to B. The children of a Vertex v are all Edges directly coming out from v. The parents of a Vertex v are all Edges directly coming into v. A graph can have any number of edges (zero, one, or more) between a pair of nodes. An Edge can have a label containing information of some sort. Labels are not unique: multiple edges may have the same label. But there is no 2 edges with the same parent and child nodes will have the same edge label.

An example of Edge can be "A Edge labeled e is a one-way connection from the Vertex named fromVertex to the Vertex named toVertex."

      public Graph.Vertex<V> getVertex(V name)

      Parameters:
      name - the given String of the name of the Vertex.
      Returns:
      return the found Vertex with the given name. If there is no Vertex with the given name, return null.

    • getEdgesFrom

      public List<Graph.Edge<V,E>> getEdgesFrom(Graph.Vertex<V> v)
      Get a list of Edges which comes out of the given Vertex, aka child Edges of v.
      Parameters:
      v - the given Vertex used to find its corresponding children.
      Returns:
      return a list of Edges which comes out of the given Vertex if the given vertex exists in the graph, else return null.
      Requires:
      v != null and vertex v exists in the graph.

    • getEdgesTo

      Parameters:
      v - the given Vertex used to find its corresponding parents.
      Returns:
      a list of Edges which goes to the given Vertex.
      Requires:
      v != null and vertex v exists in the graph.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(Graph.Vertex<V> v1, Graph.Vertex<V> v2, Graph.Edge<V,E> e)
      Add the given Edge e to the children Edges list of v1 and the parent Edges list of v2.
      Parameters:
      v1 - the given Vertex which the Edge comes from.
      v2 - the given Vertex which the Edge goes to.
      e - the given Edge which try to be the connection from v1 to v2.
      Modifies:
      this.
      Effects:
      this.
      Requires:
      v1 != null and v2 != null and e != null and e.fromVertex != null and e.toVertex != null and Edge e does not exist in this graph.

    • containsEdge

      public boolean containsEdge(E label, Graph.Vertex<V> v1, Graph.Vertex<V> v2)
      Checks whether the edge from v1 to v2 exists in this graph.
      Parameters:
      label - the label of the given edge
      v1 - the start vertex of the given edge
      v2 - the end vertex of the given edge
      Returns:
      true if this graph contains the given edge, else return false.
